page.title: 03CRICKET CLUBS IN SOUTHPORT
page.content: In 1902,the Southport Cricket club joined in with the Birkdale Cricket club,which was founded in 1874,to form the Southport and Birkdale Cricket club.The Southport and Birkdale Cricket club which is in Trafalgar road Birkdale has various facilities for people with different tastes.At first it was a reasonably small club but has since grown in stature.There is cricket for people aged 10 to 18 (approximately).On Monday the youngest people attend,on Tuesday the next youngest and so on.After the practice the children are allowed to buy a drink from the bar.There is also a snooker room where only 18's are allowed to play unless the youngsters are with an adult.You have to pay for the lights which are 20 pence for an hour and once the light goes out and if someone is waiting you have to stop
